title: Fix skia submodule to point to squashed commit
body:
The previous PR merged the skia submodule pointing to a branch commit that was deleted after squash merge. This updates it to point to the actual squashed commit on the skiasharp branch.

- Updates externals/skia from b606bdccd2 → 346cbd67e0

comments.author: github-actions[bot]
comments.body:
**Triage Summary**  

Labels will be applied to denote the affected area of the SkiaSharp project and its backend related to the Skia submodule update.

This issue is not a regression since there are no concerns regarding compatibility, performance, or reliability.

Additional remarks:
* There is no information about any specific operating system or platform mentioned in the issue, so no platform-related labels can be assigned.
* The issue describes an update to a submodule rather than a functional change.

<details>
<summary>Detailed Summary and Actions</summary>

Summary of the triage:

- The issue specifically relates to the Skia submodule in the SkiaSharp project.
- The appropriate labels to apply are `area/SkiaSharp` and `backend/SkiaSharp`.
- There are no platform-specific labels to be assigned due to lack of information.

Summary of the actions that will be performed:

| Action      | Item                   | Description                                                                                                                                               |
| :---------- | :--------------------- | :-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Apply Label | area/SkiaSharp        | The issue specifically relates to updating the Skia submodule in the SkiaSharp project, relevant to its core library.                                   |
| Apply Label | backend/SkiaSharp     | The issue addresses a fix tied specifically to the backend of SkiaSharp regarding the Skia submodule update.                                            |

</details>



_This entire triage process was automated by AI and mistakes may have been made. Please let us know so we can continue to improve._
